description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to support the Federal Government of Somalia (FGS) and the Federal Member States (FMS) to implement their chosen method of State Administration and Federalism process

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Multi Partner Trust Fund for Somalia

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

provider-org.narrative: United Nations Multi Partner Trust Fund for Somalia

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. Processes for inclusive and gender-responsive national reconciliation mechanisms established and operational 2. National Reconciliation Framework in place 3. Independent Commission for Boundaries and Federalism (ICBF) leads an inclusive process on boundaries demarcation. 4. State and Non-State/civil society engage on state-building 5. Citizen Report Card System in place 6. Road map for further federalization with roles and responsibilities at different levels of government agreed 7. Communication Strategy Agreed and being Implemented. 8. Basic infrastructure and working environment in place for high priority ministries at FGS and FMS

comment.narrative: 1. Absence of a mechanism for consultations on federalism 2. No Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), no GIS/Tools 3. Absence of roles and responsibilities 4. No communications strategy 5. All baseline assessments of key priority office infrastructure completed in all FMS

1. National reconciliation framework/strategic plan in place by end of 2019. 2.Ongoing Institutional capacity development, training and support for necessary research and diagnostics, support to national reconciliation conferences and associated meetings 3. Public grievance System processes defined in drafted SOPs 4. Legal framework in place to establish National Trust and Reconciliation Commission; 5.A public grievance mechanism developed at FGS and FMS level 6. Reconciliation plans for FMS in place and at least 2 administrative mediation processes with FGS towards state building.

1. National Reconciliation Framework developed and validated by Federal Cabinet in March 2019. 2. Inception workshop on Reconciliation and Statebuilding was held in April 2019 3. Federalism workshops was successfully held including in Jowhar, Hirshabelle to discuss federalism system and intended improvements 4. MoIFAR developed a preliminary NRF implementation plan in May 2019. 5. Galmudug Reconciliation conference was successfully held in September 2019

- National Reconciliation Commission/ Forum established and Reconciliation Plans at FGS and FMS prepared and implement - Independent Commission for Boundaries and Federalism (ICBF) has a unified standardized, appropriate, and collaborative process for the establishment of administrative boundaries and an Appeal Process. - State and Non-State Actors Capacity in Conflict Mitigation and Government-Citizen Engagement Strengthened - Vertical coherence, consistency, and coordination across all levels of Government is achieved - Public Awareness and CSO Engagement on the Federalism Model Strengthened - Support provided to High Priority Ministry Refurbishments and Reequipping including IT and MIS

Developed an empirical baseline informing/updating/operationalizing Regional Reconciliation Plans (RRPs), Somalia Reconciliation Index (SRI). Bridging information and coordination gaps/disconnect between and within national counterparts and development partners. (All FMSes excluding Somaliland, including Benadiir region).
BFC developed basic delimitation guidelines and procedures; conducted delimitation conflict assessment and identified key disputed boundary lines between the FMS.
Completed the delimitation line BW Hirshabelle and South-West
South-West Reached state-level agreement on working with delimitation line between Puntland and Galmudug, and Galmudug and Hirshabelle.
The national district names and numbers were collected and IBFC reached bilateral agreements in all FMSes to conduct district validation conference.
Conducted a pilot study on settlement verification on Adado district
Provided strategic, technical, and operational support for conflict resolution of inter-clan and intra-clan conflicts, prioritized through conflict mapping. (FGS/FMS counterparts) reconciliation and mediation efforts between the two pastoralist Sa’ad and Ayr subclans of the Hawiye clan in the Hanabure settlement (50 KM north of Dhusamareb) in Galmudug and Mohamoud Saleebaan and Ugaar Salaabeen kin groups in Puntland.
Research. Mapping study of women peacebuilding actors in Somalia (all FMSes including Banaadir region)
ivic Education. Civic engagement and public outreach campaigns on reconciliation and federalization in Somalia (Hirshabelle State of Somalia)
Civic Engagement. Enhancing civil societys engagement in peacebuilding, state-building, and reconciliation processes (Puntland State of Somalia)
Advocacy. Enhancing youth engagement through cultural activities (SouthWest State of Somalia) Capacity Building. Engaging community of elders for conflict resolution at the local levels (Galmudug State of Somalia
Provided operational and logistical support to facilitate the implementation of Mogadishu Agreement on electoral model for peaceful transition of power.
Identified irritants and pathways to unlock current stalemate on power sharing, resource distribution and functional assignments between FGS and FMSes.
Facilitate periodical inter-ministerial/inter-governmental coordination meetings, involving FGS and FMS level counterparts, and prepare comprehensive reports to facilitate the issue-mapping and performance tracking with focus on IGR. (OPM/GSS/HSS)
Developed technical papers and organize policy discussions on: (a) Vertical Dimensions of IGR, (b) Horizontal Dimensions of IGR and (c) Sectoral Dimensions of IGR to help scenario building in Somalia.
Facilitated strategic follow-up/advocacy and lobbying on the finalization and endorsement of draft IGR Bill for subsequent legislation.
Promoted Trak III; Selected CSOs will present their approach, methodology, areas of operation, nature of activities, results and lessons learnt. Based on the proceedings of the Summit, a Compendium on Social Reconciliation would be compiled and translated in Somali language for wider dissemination.
Enhanced the institutional capacity of counterparts by embedding technical, specialized and professional assistance with the eight FGS/FMS counterparts. Precise areas of capacity and skill improvement include: policy research, strategic communication, networking, partnership building, office management, project planning and management.

1. at least 3 Intergovernmental Relations Forums (FGS and FMS) on federalism conducted. 2. Support provided to Technical Committees and other stakeholders in drafting policy documents on Federal/FMS roles and relations. 3. 6 Regional Conferences held 4. At least 4 Consultations on federalism including guidelines on roles and responsibilities at different levels of government drafted 5. Guidelines on federalism, including on roles and responsibilities at different levels of government drafted and agreed

• The project supported to conduct 3 IGR consultations and forums in FGS and FMS levels. By recognizing the importance of effective management of Inter-Governmental Relations (IGR) as one of the key constituents of functional federal structure, the project supported IGR consultation meeting jointly organized by the Office of Prime Minister (OPM), Ministry of Constitutional Affairs (MOCA) and MOIFAR-FGS in Mogadishu. The MoIFAR-FGS, OPM and MOCA convened an inter-ministerial consultation on June 14th 2020 in Mogadishu to review and analyze the draft IGR Act 2020. The meeting resolved to expand the scope of consultation by inviting FMS counterparts to discuss and iron out institutional, administrative and technical aspects of draft IGR Act that inform inclusive policy choices at political levels. The meeting also agreed to develop a Technical Working Group/Committee drawing representation from FGS and FMSes to review and suggest improvements in the draft IGR Act 2020 looking at vertical, horizontal and sectoral dimensions of IGR in the context of Somalia. - The project provided support to Inter-Ministerial Technical Committees in drafting IGR Act which describes the roles, responsibilities and relations between FGS and FMS relevant institutions. • The project supported various regional conferences related to federalism and reconciliation trainings/workshops were held in the various Federal Member States on the concept of federalism, (distribution of powers, state legitimacy & intergovernmental relations), peacebuilding and reconciliation efforts. These workshops participated by various clan elders, council of elders, women and youth groups, district officials, religious people and other government officials in the respective states of Jubaland, Southwest State, Hirshabelle, Galmudug and Puntland States. The federalism workshops have enabled participants to comprehend Federalism and State-building initiatives thus resulting mass awareness on these two components (Federalism & state building). The participants had negative notions about federalism but upon completion of these trainings and workshops which relates to federalism and state building, the trainees were about to understand the meaning, significance and mode of Federalism as system of Governance. • The project provided technical support to the three-week Inter-Ministerial Working Sessions on Distribution of Resources and Allocation of Powers jointly organized by the Ministry of Constitutional Affairs (MOCA) and the Ministry of Interior, Federal Affairs and Reconciliation (MOIFAR) of the Federal Government of Somalia that was held in February 2020. The objective of the exercise was to inform the ongoing Constitutional Review Process on federalist principles and policy options for equitable functional assignments between FGS and FMS relevant institutions. Similarly, the project technically supported MoIFAR-FGS to facilitate 2 consultations workshops on the policy framework for participatory federalism and decentralization in Somalia. The objectives of those consultations were aimed to develop guidelines, roles and responsibilities at different levels of government. Participants were about 5 relevant line ministries from the respective FMS and Banadir Regional Administration (BRA).
- As above
